title: VBLENDMPD/VBLENDMPS â€” Blend Float64/Float32 Vectors Using an OpMask Control

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VBLENDMPD xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m64bcst`
`VBLENDMPD ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m64bcst`
`VBLENDMPD zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m64bcst`
`VBLENDMPS xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m32bcst`
`VBLENDMPS ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m32bcst`
`VBLENDMPS zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m32bcst`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Performs an element-by-element blending between float64/float32 elements in the first source operand (the second operand) with the elements in the second source operand (the third operand) using an opmask register as select control. The blended result is written to the destination register.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The destination and first source operands are ZMM/YMM/XMM registers. The second source operand can be a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location or a 512/256/128-bit vector broadcasted from a 64-bit memory location.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The opmask register is not used as a writemask for this instruction. Instead, the mask is used as an element selector: every element of the destination is conditionally selected between first source or second source using the value of the related mask bit (0 for first source operand, 1 for second source operand).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: If EVEX.z is set, the elements with corresponding mask bit value of 0 in the destination operand are zeroed.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
